newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa minister says privatisation not a panacea.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa minister says privatisation not a panacea.

text.p: Privatisation should not be seen as a panacea for all South Africa's inherited social and economic imbalances, Deputy Finance Minister Gill Marcus said on Wednesday.

"It is widely recognised that government alone cannot bear the entire responsibility of providing housing, infrastructure and other basic services," Marcus said in a mini-debate in the national assembly.
She said that government would be looking at public-private sector partnerships in the provision of basic services, particularly in relation to local needs.
"This is not seen simply as a panacea for all ills but as a way of building partnerships to enable different sectors to gain access to a wider range of services, skills and resources," Marcus said.
She noted that government had wider responsibilities than the private sector with its primary focus on financial returns, especially with regard to poor people who had little monetary power.
Government's role was to provide the legal, fiscal and regulatory framework needed to galvanise resources and meet demand, she said.
"We are looking at restructuring state assets, not simply privatisation..."
She said the proceeds of privatisation would be used to retire state debt, expand services, ensure technological and skills transfer, or a combination of any of these.
